method.Step 4: Return the beef to the pan with the chopped tomatoes, beef stock, sugar, dried oregano and bay leaves. Season lightly, part-cover, then simmer gently for 2½ hours. Add the cooked beans (see tip) to the pan and simmer, uncovered, fora further 20-30 minutes, stirring gently now and then so as not to break up the meat, until the liquid has reduced to a sauce and the beef is meltingly tender (see Get Ahead).

method.Step 5: To serve, mix the salsa ingredients in a bowl with a little salt to taste. Taste and adjust the seasoning of the chilli con carne, if necessary. Remove the bay leaves and serve on steamed white rice with soured cream and the salsa, garnished with the chopped fresh coriander.

title: Cheesy quesadillas with tomato, red pepper and avocado salsa
time: Hands-on time 30 min
description: These quick quesadillas make a cracking crowdpleaser and only take half an hour to make.
ingredients: Finely grated zest and juice of 1 lime

method.Step 1: Mix the avocados, cherry tomatoes, coriander, shallot, the zest and juice of 1 lime, 1 tbsp olive oil and plenty of salt and pepper in a bowl.

method.Step 2: In another bowl, mix together the cheddar, roasted red peppers, chipotle chilli flakes and some black pepper. Divide the mixture between 2 small corn tortillas and top with 2 more small corn tortillas.

method.Step 3: Heat a dry frying pan over a medium heat and toast the quesadillas for 2 minutes on each side until golden, crisp and oozy. Cut the quesadillas into wedges and serve with the salsa and soured cream.

title: Prawn tacos
time: Hands-on time 30 min
description: Soft tortillas are filled with fajita-spiced prawns, soured cream and a pretty pink pickled cabbage mix. They’re fun to make with kids and only take half an hour.
ingredients: Large handful fresh coriander, leaves roughly chopped
2 tsp fajita spice mix (Schwartz, Bart or Old El Paso)

method.Step 1: Toss the cabbage in a bowl with a large pinch of sea salt and the juice of2 of the limes. Set aside for 10 minutes to slightly pickle. Mix in the sliced radishes and most of the coriander.

method.Step 2: Meanwhile, mash the avocado in a small bowl with the remaining lime juice, salt and ground black pepper.

method.Step 3: Heat a griddle pan until hot. Toss the prawns in a bowl with the fajita spice mix and oil, then cook for 2 minutes on each side or until cooked through.

method.Step 4: To serve, warm the tortillas in the microwave (or in a hot oven or dry frying pan), then top with the soured cream, pickled veg, mashed avocado, prawns and remaining coriander.

title: Mexican chicken taco salad
time: Hands-on time 15 min
description: Try our filling main-course salad of Mexican-spiced chicken, lots of veggies and a creamy chilli dressing.
ingredients: 2 large red peppers, cut into large chunks
4 large salad onions, cut into thirds lengthways or 1 red onion cut into wedges
1-2 tbsp chilli sauce (such as chipotle sauce or Cholula)
Grated zest 2 limes and juice 1, the remaining lime cut into wedges
4 large or 6 small corn tortillas (we used Wahaca flour and yellow corn tortillas from Ocado)
Large handful fresh coriander, leaves picked and chopped
1 ready-roasted rotisserie chicken (roughly 900g), cut into chunky portions

method.Step 1: Heat a griddle pan or grill to high. Toss the peppers and onions in the oil and cook for 1-2 minutes on each side until slightly softened and lightly charred. Set aside.

method.Step 2: Meanwhile make a dressing by mixing the chilli sauce, lime zest and juice, and mayo until smooth, then set aside. Put the lettuce and tomatoes in a large bowl.

method.Step 3: Griddle/grill the tortillas for 30 seconds or so on each side until lightly toasted, then cut into wedges. Toss the peppers, onions, coriander and a little dressing with the rest of the salad and season with salt and pepper. Tip the dressed salad onto a serving platter, arrange the chicken portions and tortillas on top and serve with the remaining dressing and lime wedges for squeezing on the side.

title: Nachos with pulled pork and sweetcorn salsa
time: Hands-on time 35 min, oven time 1 hour 40-45 min
description: Layer up nachos with succulent pulled pork, cheddar and a sweet and zingy sweetcorn salsa. Friday night in just got a whole lot better, thanks to our easy nachos recipe.
ingredients: 600g British free-range pork shoulder, cut into 2cm cubes
2 tsp each dried thyme and dried oregano
½-1 jalapeño chilli or red chilli, deseeded and finely chopped
1 ripe avocado, peeled and cut into small dice
1 small bunch fresh coriander, finely chopped

method.Step 1: To make the pulled pork, heat the oven to 200°C/180°C fan/gas 6. Heat the oil in a large flameproof casserole (one with a lid) on a medium heat, then fry the shallots for 5-6 minutes, stirring often, until slightly softened but not coloured. Turn up the heat, season the pork with salt, then add to the pan and fry for 4-5 minutes, stirring, until the meat has coloured slightly on the outside. Reduce the heat to medium, add the garlic and cook, stirring, for 1-2 minutes, then add all the spices and dried herbs. Stir to coat the meat and fry for 2 minutes until the spices are fragrant. (If they start to catch on the bottom of the pan adda splash of water and keep stirring.)

method.Step 2: Stir in the tomato purée and red wine vinegar and cook for 2-3 minutes. Pour in the chicken stock and add the sugar and milk, bring everything to a simmer, then put the lid on and transfer to the oven. Cook for 1½ hours, stirring halfway through, until the pork falls apart easily when pressed with a spoon.

method.Step 3: When the meat is tender, remove it to a bowl using a slotted spoon and put the pan with the remaining sauce on the hob. Bring back to a simmer for 10 minutes or until reduced by half. Meanwhile, shred the pork with 2 forks, then add it back to the sauce, stir and set aside until ready to assemble the nachos.

method.Step 4: To make the salsa, put the red onion, vinegar and sugar in a glass or ceramic bowl with a generous scattering of salt and stir to combine. Leave for 10 minutes so the onions lightly pickle, then stir in the remaining ingredients, taste and season again. Chill until ready to serve.

method.Step 5: To assemble the nachos, heat the oven to 200°C/180°C fan/gas 6. Scatter the tortilla chips in a baking dish or tray, then spoon over the warm pork. Sprinkle with as much grated cheese as you see fit, then heat in the oven for 10-15 minutes until the cheese has melted. Spoon the salsa over the top, then serve with any extra salsa, and the soured cream and jalapeños if you like.

title: Crispy Mexican tortilla rice bowl
time: Hands-on time 20 min
description: Cooking for one needn’t be a chore. This flavour-packed Mexican meal is on the table in just 20 minutes but tastes like it took much longer.
ingredients: 50g roasted red peppers from a jar, chopped
Grated zest 1 lime and juice ½ lime
140g pouch Tilda Pulses and Rice (black bean, jerk and coconut)

method.Step 1: Heat the oil in a large frying pan over a medium heat. Cut the tortilla in half, then into strips about 1cm wide. Fry in the pan, turning once, for 3-4 minutes until golden and crisp. Set aside on kitchen paper to drain.

method.Step 2: Make a salsa by mixing the red peppers, sweetcorn, onion, most of the coriander and the lime juice ina bowl, then season with salt and pepper. In a separate small bowl, stir the lime zest and paprika into the soured cream.

method.Step 3: Empty the pouch of pulses into a serving bowl and mix in half the salsa and half the tortilla strips. Top with the sliced avocado and the rest of the salsa and tortilla strips, then drizzle over the spiced soured cream and scatter with the remaining coriander.

title: Charred corn and chicken tacos
time: Hands-on time 30 min
description: Lightly charred summer sweetcorn is the star of this quick chicken taco recipe. We love the smoky flavour when cooked on a barbecue but the recipe works just as well on a griddle pan too.
ingredients: 1 tbsp chipotle sauce (we used Tabasco chipotle sauce)
8 small or 4 large, soft corn tortillas
2 cooked free-range chicken breasts, sliced (see Next Time)

method.Step 1: Light a barbecue or heat a griddle pan to high. In a small bowl, mix the oil, paprika, chipotle sauce and the finely grated zest and juice of 1½ limes. Transfer 2 tbsp to a separate bowl and mix with the mayo to make a dressing.Set aside.

method.Step 2: When the barbecue coals are glowing white or the griddle pan is hot, peel back the husks from the corn, cut off or tie back with string, then brush each cob with some chipotle and lime mixture. Cook, turning and basting with the rest of the chipotle and lime mixture, until beginning to char on all sides (10-15 minutes). Once cool enough to handle, hold each cob vertically on a secure chopping board and carefully slice down the sides with a sharp knife to remove the kernels.

method.Step 3: Warm the tortillas on the barbecue or in the griddle pan for 1-2 minutes. Top with avocado, chicken (or see Next Time), spring onions, tomatoes, charred corn, a spoonful of dressing and a few coriander leaves. Serve with the remaining limes, cut into wedges, for squeezing.

title: Mexican chicken burgers
time: Hands-on time 40 min, plus marinating
description: It’s too difficult to choose between fajitas or burgers so we’ve put juicy chipotle-spiced chicken, guacamole and fresh coriander between two buns.
ingredients: 4 tbsp cold-pressed rapeseed oil or olive oil
Juice 3 limes, plus 4 lime wedges to serve
2 red onions, finely sliced into rings
1 red chilli, deseeded and finely chopped
Large bunch fresh coriander, roughly chopped
Grilled crusty roll, chopped fresh coriander, soured cream and curly fries (optional)

method.Step 1: Put the chicken breasts between 2 sheets of baking paper and use a meat tenderiser or rolling pin to flatten them to a 2-3cm thickness. Put the chicken in a non-metallic bowl with the oil, cumin, juice of 2 limes, the sliced garlic clove and half the chipotle paste. Marinate for at least 30 minutes, but preferably overnight, in the fridge.

method.Step 2: Put the onion rings in a bowl of water (to reduce the sharpness). In another bowl, mash the avocados with the crushed garlic, the rest of the lime juice and chipotle paste, the chilli and half the coriander.

method.Step 3: When the chicken has marinated, heat a large griddle pan. Once the pan is smoking hot, add the chicken and griddle for 5-6 minutes on each side, basting with the marinade. The chicken should be lightly charred and cooked through – cut into the thickest part to check.

method.Step 4: To serve, layer the grilled rolls with the mashed avocado, onion rings and chicken, sprinkle with the remaining coriander and serve with soured cream, lime wedges and curly fries (if you like).

title: Mexican fish tacos
time: Hands-on time 45 min
description: Serve all the elements of these fish tacos in separate bowls for a sharing-style family dinner. The cooling guacamole nicely complements the heat from the spice rubbed cod – making it easy to tailor the dish to your taste.
ingredients: 800g sustainable cod fillets, cut into 3cm pieces
Large bunch each fresh flatleaf parsley, basil and mint, chopped
½ red onion, very thinly sliced

method.Step 1: Put the cod fillets onto a plate and cover with the salt. Leave for 15 minutes or so, then rinse off the salt using plenty of cold water and thoroughly pat the fish fillets dry with kitchen paper. Slice the fish into 3cm pieces and put into a bowl.

method.Step 2: Mix all the spice rub ingredients together in a small bowl, then sprinkle over the cod and turn the fillets to coat evenly.

method.Step 3: Put the guacamole ingredients into a mini chopper with salt and pepper, whizz to a rough paste and set aside. (Or mash the avocado in a bowl, then stir in the remaining ingredients and seasoning.) Toss together the salad ingredients and season well.

method.Step 4: Heat a frying pan with a splash of oil. When the pan is really hot, add the fish and fry for 2-3 minutes. Turn the fish carefully, trying not to break it up too much (it will need 4-5 minutes in total), remove and set aside. Add the tortillas and fry for a minute on each side to warm. (If you have a gas hob, lightly char the tortillas in the flame using tongs.)

method.Step 5: Layer the fish, guacamole, salad and soured cream in the wraps to serve.

title: Brazilian black bean soup with raw corn salsa
time: Hands-on time 35 min, simmering time 45 min
description: ”Black beans, a core ingredient in Brazilian cooking, have a wonderful colour and such a rich taste that you don’t need to add lots of other ingredients.” – Jane Muir, founder of Mildreds
ingredients: 3 roasted red peppers from a jar, drained and roughly chopped
1 small sweet potato, peeled and diced into 2cm pieces
2 corn cobs, kernels sliced off with a sharp knife (or, if not in season,150g frozen sweetcorn, defrosted)
½ small red onion, finely diced

method.Step 1: Heat a splash of oil in a large saucepan, add the onions, chillies and garlic and cook over a medium heat, stirring frequently, until the onions are translucent.

method.Step 2: Add the spices and cook over a low heat, stirring, for 1-2 minutes, then add the beans in their liquid, stock and bay leaves to the pan. Bring up to a low simmer.

method.Step 3: Add the peppers and sweet potato and cook gently, uncovered, for 45 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the sweet potato is cooked but not disintegrating.

method.Step 4: Meanwhile, make the salsa. Mix the corn kernels in a bowl with the remaining ingredients and stir to combine.

method.Step 5: Before serving, transfer one third of the soup to a food processor and whizz until smooth. Return to the pan and stir into the rest of the soup, then reheat, adding a little water to loosen if necessary.

method.Step 6: Serve in bowls with a spoonful of corn salsa and lime wedges to squeeze over.

title: Cornbread with deep-fried crispy onions
time: Hands-on time 30 min, oven time 25-30 min
description: Deep-fried spring onions are taken one step further with a cornmeal crunch, before being topped on a cheesy, spring onion-spiked cornbread.
ingredients: 1 bunch spring onions, sliced in half lengthways
1-2 tsp chipotle chilli paste (we like Gran Luchito Mexico Smoked Chipotle Chilli Paste)
20cm square cake tin, fully lined with non-stick baking paper

method.Step 1: Heat the oven to 200°C/180°C fan/gas 6. Sift the 150g plain flour into a large mixing bowl and stir in the cornmeal/polenta, salt, baking powder, sugar, mustard powder, cayenne, 150g of the grated cheese, the chilli and the sliced spring onions. Make a well in the centre.

method.Step 2: In a jug, mix the melted butter with the buttermilk, eggs and olive oil and pour into the well. Stir quickly to combine, then pour into the cake tin. Sprinkle with the rest of the cheese, then bake for 25-30 minutes until golden and a skewer pushed into the middle comes out clean.

method.Step 3: Meanwhile, fry the spring onions. Fill a heavy-based deep pan with 6-8cm oil, then put over a medium heat until it reads 180°C on a digital probe thermometer (or a cube of bread turns golden in 30-40 seconds). Line a baking tray with kitchen paper and set aside.

method.Step 4: In a wide shallow bowl mix the flour, mustard powder, garlic salt, cayenne pepper and a good pinch of salt. Beat the 2 eggs and put in another bowl, then put the cornmeal/polenta in a third similar bowl. Dust the spring onions all over in the seasoned flour, then coat in the egg, then finally toss in the cornmeal/polenta to coat.

method.Step 5: Working in batches, fry the spring onions until golden brown (3-4 minutes), then scoop out with a wire basket or tongs and lay on the prepared tray. Immediately sprinkle with lime juice, lime zest and salt. Cook the rest of the onions.

method.Step 6: Mix all the mayonnaise ingredients in a small bowl and season to taste. Once the cornbread is cooked, top with the crispy onions with the mayo alongside for dipping.

title: Corned beef and bean hash with chimichurri
time: Hands-on time 15 min, oven time 20 min
description: A tasty, filing and budget-friendly recipe with a Mexican twist. Serve as an easy midweek meal to feed the family with extra lime wedges and chilli.
ingredients: 500g sweet potatoes, cut into medium chunks
Small bunch fresh coriander or parsley (or ½ bunch each), finely chopped
Grated zest 1 lime, juice 2 limes, plus wedges (optional) to serve
400g can black beans, drained and rinsed

method.Step 1: Heat the oven to 220°C/200°C fan/gas 7. Put the sweet potatoes in a roasting tin, drizzle over 1 tbsp oil, season, then roast for 20 minutes.

method.Step 2: Meanwhile, mix the herbs with the lime zest and juice to make the chimichurri salsa. Set aside.

method.Step 3: Heat 1 tbsp oil in a wide frying pan and cook the onion for 6-7 minutes or until golden, then add the garlic, paprika and cumin (if using). Cook, stirring, for 2 more minutes.

method.Step 4: Add the corned beef and black beans, stirring gently, and cook until heated through and turning crisp. Stir in the roasted sweet potato, then taste and season. Drizzle with the chimichurri and serve with lime wedges and chillies, if you like.

title: Slow-cooked duck tacos with pineapple salsa
time: Hands-on time 15 min, oven time 2 hours
description: Melt-in-your-mouth slow-cooked, tequila-spiked duck, fiery pineapple salsa and creamy chipotle mayo all wrapped up in a soft tortilla. Gather the troops – it’s Mexican night!
ingredients: 4 Gressingham duck legs, pierced all over with the tip of a sharp knife
1 medium pineapple, peeled, halved and cored
200ml tequila (we used El Jimador), plus a splash for the salsa
2 jalapeño chillies (or 1 red chilli), deseeded and finely chopped
Shallow flameproof casserole or large ovenproof frying pan

method.Step 1: Heat the oven to 160°C/140°C fan/gas 3. Heat a splash of oil in the casserole/pan over a medium-high heat. Add the duck legs, skin-side down, and brown for 5 minutes.

method.Step 2: Chop half the pineapple and whizz in a food processor with the tequila, stock, chipotle paste, chilli flakes and seasoning to make a smooth sauce. (Alternatively, use a bowl and a stick blender.)

method.Step 3: Pour away any excess fat from the duck and add the whizzed sauce to the casserole or pan. Bring to a fast simmer, then put in the oven and cook, uncovered, for 2 hours.

method.Step 4: For the pineapple salsa, finely dice the remaining pineapple and put in a bowl with the chopped red onion, chillies and most of the coriander. Add a splash of tequila and the juice of ½ lime, season and set aside.

method.Step 5: Mix the chipotle mayo ingredients in a bowl and season. To serve, warm the tortillas in the oven. Slice the avocados, shred the lettuce and toss in a serving bowl with the juice of the remaining ½ lime and some salt and black pepper.

method.Step 6: Using 2 forks, shred the duck meat, then mix back into the sauce (discard the skin and bones). Add a squeeze more lime and seasoning, then serve in the tortillas with the mayo, salad and salsa, remaining coriander and lime wedges for squeezing.

title: Mexican picadillo pasties
time: Hands-on time 1 hour, oven time 1 hour, plus chilling
description: Debbie Major ramps up the flavour of a classic Cornish pasty with this Mexican version (just don’t tell them in Penzance)
ingredients: 1 quantity pastry (see Debbie Major’s Cornish pasties)
1 medium-hot jalapeño chilli, seeded and finely chopped
1 tbsp small capers, rinsed and drained

method.Step 1: Make and chill the pastry as in the master recipe on p36 (steps 1-4). Mix the remaining pasty ingredients (except the egg) in a bowl with 1 tsp salt and plenty of freshly ground black pepper, then set aside.

method.Step 2: Once the pastry has chilled, roll out, fill and shape the pasties as in the master recipe (step 6), then chill for 1 hour.

method.Step 3: Heat the oven to 180°C/160°C fan/gas 4. Remove the pasties from the fridge and brush generously with the beaten egg. Make 3 small slits in the top of each, then bake for 1 hour until richly golden. Transfer to a wire cooling rack. Eat while still warm.

title: Smoky pork and black bean stew with kale
time: Hands-on time 30 min
description: “Black beans and kale are both good sources of the B vitamin folate (also known as folic acid).” – Amanda Ursell, nutritionist.
ingredients: Mild, light olive oil for frying
1 x 28g chicken stock pot (we used Knorr)
Cooked quinoa or wholegrain rice and lemon or lime wedges to serve

method.Step 1: Boil a kettle of water. Heat a splash of olive oil in a large, deep frying pan and fry the pork for 5 minutes until browned all over. Set the meat aside on a plate and add more oil to the pan. Cook the onions for 5-6 minutes until starting to soften, then stir in the spices and cook for 1 minute more.

method.Step 2: Dissolve the stock pot in a jug with 400ml hot water from the kettle. Return the pork to the pan, add the beans and stock, then bring to a simmer and cook for 5 minutes.

method.Step 3: Add the kale to the pan and cook for 5 minutes more, then stir in the butter to thicken the sauce a little. Taste, season and serve with quinoa or rice, with lemon or lime wedges to squeeze over.

title: Mexican veggie and tortilla soup
time: Hands-on time 15 min, simmering time 15 min
description: What if you could have a soup that tasted like nachos? Well now you can. Full of vibrant Mexican flavours, this vegetarian soup is topped with tortilla chips and ready in a flash.
ingredients: 1 Knorr Vegetable Stockpot dissolved in 300ml boiling water (we like Knorr)
30g cheddar cheese, grated and ½ avocado, diced

method.Step 1: Heat a little oil in a saucepan and fry onion until soft (1-2 minutes). Add pepper and fry a further 1 minutes.

method.Step 2: Stir in tomatoes, chipotle sauce, stock and sweetcorn. Simmer for 12-15 minutes.

method.Step 3: Serve in bowls topped with the tortilla chips, and top with cheese and avocado if using.

title: Smoky sausage chilli
portion: Makes enough for two meals for 4 people
time: Hands-on time 20 min, simmering time 45 min
description: We’ve doubled the quantities of this sensational smoky sausage chilli so you can eat half now and freeze the other half for another meal.
ingredients: 12 free-range pork sausages, cut into chunks
Steamed basmati rice, 1 sliced red chilli, fresh coriander leaves, soured cream, lime wedges and tortilla chips to serve

method.Step 1: Heat a glug of oil in the casserole over a medium heat. Add the carrots, celery, garlic and bay leaves, then fry for 10 minutes until the vegetables are starting to soften. Add the cumin, coriander and chipotle paste, then cook for 2-3 minutes.

method.Step 2: Add the sausages and fry for 5 minutes (there’s no need to fully brown them), then add the chopped tomatoes and 150ml water. Season with black pepper, then bring to a simmer, put the lid on and cook for 45 minutes until the sausages are cooked through and the sauce is flavoursome – if the sauce is a little too thick for your liking, add a splash of water.

method.Step 3: Transfer a third of the chilli to a freezerproof container and allow to cool, then freeze (see box, top of page opposite). Serve the remaining chilli with steamed rice, fresh red chilli, fresh coriander leaves, lime wedges and tortilla chips if you like.

title: Vegan chilli with rice
portion: Makes 8 portions (enough for two meals for 4)
time: Hands-on time 20 min, simmering time 45-50 min
description: Make this comforting vegetarian chilli, serve half now and freeze the rest for later. You can use the leftovers in our mash potato-topped gardener’s pie.
ingredients: 1 butternut squash, cut into chunks (we used 700g ready-cut chunks)
400g tin pinto beans, rinsed and drained
400g tin brown lentils, rinsed and drained
Large handful chopped fresh coriander, plus leaves to garnish
Steamed basmati rice,  plant-based yogurt and lime wedges to serve

method.Step 1: Heat the olive oil in a large heavy-based frying pan with a lid over a low-medium heat. Add the onions, peppers, celery, squash and a large pinch of salt and cook, covered, for 20 minutes.

method.Step 2: Remove the lid, stir in the garlic, dried spices and chipotle paste and cook for 2 minutes. Stir in the passata, 240ml water, a good glug of red wine, if using, and the stock pot. Bring to the boil, then turn the heat down to low and simmer uncovered for 20 minutes. Add the beans and lentils and cook for 5-10 minutes more to heat through.

method.Step 3: Pour half into a freezerproof container to cool before freezing (see tips below). Stir the coriander into the remaining chilli, then serve with rice, yogurt, lime wedges and extra coriander leaves.

title: Easy shakshuka
time: Hands-on time 50 min
description: We think this easy shakshuka – a classic Middle Eastern lunch dish – is brilliant served any time, mopped up with good bread.

method.Step 1: Heat the oil in a large frying pan over the campfire (or barbecue or hob). Add the onions, peppers, chillies, garlic and spices, then fry gently for 10 minutes until the veg has softened and turned golden. Add the tomatoes, sugar, bay leaves and thyme, stir to combine, then season and simmer for 20-30 minutes until thickened, adding a little water if it looks too thick or starts to catch.

method.Step 2: Make four indentations in the sauce and crack an egg into each one. Cover the pan with a lid or foil and cook for 3-4 minutes until the whites are set but the yolks are still a little soft. Scatter with chopped parsley and serve from the pan.

title: Spicy ancho chilli, chicken and chorizo hotpot
time: Hands-on time 40 min, oven time 55 min
description: The ancho chillies give this hotpot a spicy and smoky kick and is incredibly easy to make. If you’re a fan of food that is big on flavour, and spice, then this is the dish for you.
ingredients: 2 ancho chillies (from large supermarkets, delis and coolchile.co.uk), soaked for 10 minutes in hot water
5cm piece fresh ginger, peeled and finely chopped
8 (about 750g) free-range skinless and boneless chicken thighs, chopped into chunks
Bunch fresh flatleaf parsley, leaves picked

method.Step 1: Drain the ancho chillies (discard the liquid) and finely chop. Heat the oven to 160°C/140°C fan/gas 3.

method.Step 2: Heat a glug of olive oil in the casserole, add the onion and fry over a medium heat for 5 minutes until starting to soften. Add the cumin and paprika and cook for 2 minutes, stirring all the time.

method.Step 3: Add the chopped ancho chillies, ginger and chorizo and cook for a further 3-4 minutes, then add the chicken and wine, bring to the boil and simmer for 5-10 minutes until the wine has reduced by half.

method.Step 4: Add the chopped tomatoes and the sugar. Season with salt and pepper, then cover, transfer to the oven and cook for 45-50 minutes. Remove from the oven and leave to stand for a few minutes.

method.Step 5: Prepare the crispy tortilla topping. Heat a dry frying pan over a medium heat and add the tortillas. Toast for 3-4 minutes until scorched and crisp. Leave them to cool, then finely slice into thin strips. Toss the strips in a large bowl with the lemon zest, then sprinkle over the casserole with the parsley to serve.

title: Harissa-spiced lamb tacos
time: Hands-on time 30 min
description: Our spicy harissa-spiced lamb tacos – served with an avocado salad – are a great midweek meal that’s ready in just 30 mins.

method.Step 1: Heat the oven to 220°C/200°C fan/gas 7. In a large frying pan, heat 1 tbsp of the oil over a medium heat. Add the onion and fry for 5 minutes until starting to soften. Add the ground coriander and fry for a few minutes, then stir in the lamb mince.

method.Step 2: Turn up the heat and fry the mince, stirring regularly, until browned and beginning to crisp (about 5 minutes). Stir in the harissa and sultanas. Cook for another 5 minutes until the mince has cooked through, then taste and season.

method.Step 3: Divide the mixture among the taco shells and arrange them carefully on a baking sheet lined with non-stick baking paper. Crumble over the feta, then bake for 10 minutes.

method.Step 4: Meanwhile, mix together the avocado and lettuce in a bowl, drizzle with the rest of the rapeseed oil and season to taste. Serve the tacos straight from the oven, scattered with  chilli (if you like a bit of heat), with the salad on the side.

title: Smoked-lentil tacos with pico de gallo
time: Hands-on time 35 min, simmering time 20 min, plus soaking
description: ”I haven’t eaten meat in a long time, but taking my first bite of these insanely tasty tacos made me feel as if I were. I used my secret weapons: tamari, sun-dried tomatoes and caramelised onions.” – Sarah Britton
ingredients: 1 tsp very finely chopped red chilli
210g dried green lentils, soaked and drained
1 large garlic clove, very finely chopped
½ tsp fine sea salt, plus extra as needed
1½ tsp lime juice, plus wedges to serve
1 tsp maple syrup, plus extra as needed
Handful chopped fresh flatleaf parsley or fresh coriander (leaves and tender stems), or a mixture
1 small red chilli, deseeded and sliced (leave the seeds in if you like more heat)

method.Step 1: For the pico de gallo, combine the cherry tomatoes, onion, chilli, lime juice and coriander in a small bowl. Season with salt and set aside.

method.Step 2: Next, cook the lentils. In a stockpot or large pan, cover the soaked lentils with water, bring to the boil, then reduce the heat to low and cook, covered, for about 20 minutes or until tender. Drain and rinse well.

method.Step 3: Meanwhile, make the slaw. In a large bowl, combine the cabbage, salt and lime juice. Massage the cabbage with the mixture for about a minute until it begins to wilt. Drizzle with the olive oil and maple syrup. Season with more salt, as needed, and stir in the herbs and chilli.

method.Step 4: Melt the coconut oil for the filling in a frying pan over a medium-high heat. Add the onions and salt, stir to coat, then cook for about 10 minutes or until the onions soften and begin to slightly caramelise.

method.Step 5: Add the garlic, sun-dried tomatoes, paprika, oregano and tamari/soy sauce. Stir to coat, adding a little water if the pot is too dry. Cook for 2-3 minutes until fragrant, then add the cooked lentils and stir well. Taste and season with salt, if needed, then remove from the heat.

method.Step 6: To assemble the tacos, divide the smoky lentil mixture among the tortillas, followed by the slaw and pico de gallo. Add the avocado, then some hot sauce, if you like. Serve with lime wedges to squeeze over.

title: Green veg and chicken tacos with pea guacamole
time: Hands-on time 20 min
description: Enjoy this recipe for your next taco night. Quick and affordable, it’s perfect for those summer evenings when you want something quick, easy and nourishing.
ingredients: 80g courgette or baby courgettes, cut into ribbons using a veg peeler
Juice 2 limes, plus wedges to serve
Large handful fresh coriander leaves, finely chopped
100g (½ tub) ready-made tomato salsa to serve

method.Step 1: Mix the sliced fennel and courgette(s) in a serving bowl with half the lime juice. Set aside.

method.Step 2: For the pea guacamole, put the peas in a bowl, cover with boiling water and leave for 5 minutes. Drain and rinse under cold water, then whizz in a food processor with the avocado and remaining lime juice until smooth. Taste and season well with salt and pepper.

method.Step 3: Toss the lettuce and chopped coriander with the fennel and courgette. Arrange the chicken and green veg on the tortillas, dollop with some pea guacamole, then serve with the tomato salsa and lime wedges for squeezing.

title: Smoky bean and sweet potato tortillas with lime-pickled onions
time: Hands-on time 20 minutes, cooking time 35 minutes
description: Take your veggie Mexican night to new heights with these smoky bean and sweet potato tortillas. They’re wonderfully warming and spicy with a citrus kick from the lime-pickled onions.
ingredients: 600g sweet potatoes, peeled and cut into 1cm dice
2 x 400g tins butter beans, drained and rinsed
400g tin black beans, drained and rinsed
Handful of fresh mint leaves, chopped

method.Step 1: To make the lime-pickled onions, toss the lime juice and sliced onion in a bowl with a good pinch of sea salt. Leave for 30 minutes, tossing occasionally, to soften and turn pink.

method.Step 2: Heat the oil in a large frying pan over a low-medium heat, then add the chopped onion, garlic and cumin. Cook for 10 minutes, then add the sweet potatoes. Fry gently for 2-3 minutes more, stirring occasionally to make sure the garlic doesn’t burn.

method.Step 3: Stir in the chipotle paste to coat the vegetables. Season well, then pour over the hot vegetable stock. Bring to the boil. Turn the heat down to a simmer, then cook for 10-15 minutes until the potatoes are tender and the stock is reduced. Taste and season.

method.Step 4: Add all the beans to the pan. Keep on the heat for a further 5 minutes, stirring, then remove and toss in the mint and coriander. Take to the table, still in the pan, then serve with the charred tortilla wraps, lime-pickled onions and soured cream.

title: Smoky coriander beef fajitas
time: Hands-on time 15 min
description: When you’ve only got minutes to spend in the kitchen, speedy steak fajitas are the perfect dinner. We’ve used jarred peppers and ready-made Mexican sauces to make this weeknight recipe even easier.
ingredients: 300g British beef rump steak, sliced into strips
Small bunch fresh coriander, stalks roughly chopped and leaves picked
100g chargrilled red peppers from a jar, cut into 1cm strips
240g mini pack Tex-Mex dips (such as soured cream, guacamole and tomato salsa)
Sliced jalapeño chillies and lime wedges (optional)

method.Step 1: Heat the oil in a large frying pan or wok over a high heat. Fry the onions for 3-4 minutes, then add the garlic and steak and fry for a minute more.

method.Step 2: Add the coriander stalks and spices, then stir-fry for another minute. Add the chargrilled peppers and cook until just warmed through, then scatter with the coriander leaves.

method.Step 3: Serve the steak with the warm tortillas and dips, along with jalapeños and lime wedges, if you like, so everyone can build their own fajita.

title: Chipotle chicken chilli with avocado
time: Hands-on time 35 min, simmering time 65 min
description: The secret ingredient in this chipotle chicken chilli? A bottle of Corona. It takes this spicy Mexican one-pot to a whole new level.
ingredients: 6 British free-range skinless boneless chicken thighs, cut into 3cm pieces
Small bunch fresh coriander, stalks finely chopped, leaves roughly chopped
2 x 400g tins kidney beans, drained and rinsed
1 red onion, finely sliced, soaked in cold water, then drained

method.Step 1: Heat the oil in a largepan over a medium heat and fry the chopped onions for 10 minutes until softened, then add the garlic and cumin and fry for a minute. Add the chicken and fry, stirring, for 5 minutes until lightly browned. Pour in the beer, bring to the boil, then simmer for 15 minutes until reduced by three quarters.

method.Step 2: Add the tomatoes, stock, coriander stalks and chipotle paste, then simmer gently for 40 minutes until the sauce has thickened. Add the beans and chilli flakes, then cook for 10 minutes. Add most of the chopped coriander leaves, taste and season.

method.Step 3: To serve, peel and slice the avocado into a bowl, then toss with the lime juice and chilli. Set a griddle/frying pan over a high heat, then char the tortillas for 20-30 seconds each. Pile the chilli, soaked onion and avocado on each tortilla, scatter with the rest of the coriander leaves, then serve with lime wedges and soured cream.

title: Braised beef chilli
time: Hands-on time 20 min, oven time 3½ hours
description: Ancho chillies, dark chocolate and paprika add wonderful flavours to this slow-cooked beef chilli. Serve it with fresh bean salsa for an impressive one-pot dish.
ingredients: 2 dried ancho chillies, soaked in hot water for 10 minutes, then roughly chopped
30g very dark chocolate (80 per cent cocoa solids), in pieces
Large bunch fresh coriander, leaves roughly chopped
200g black eye beans, drained and rinsed
Bunch fresh coriander, leaves roughly chopped

method.Step 1: Heat the oven to 150°C/130°C fan/gas 2. Heat a glug of oil in a large lidded flameproof casserole over a medium heat. Fry the onions for 5 minutes, then add the spices and cook for 2-3 minutes more.

method.Step 2: Add the beef, turn up the heat and fry for 5-8 minutes to brown, stirring regularly. Add the peppers and fry for a further 5 minutes.

method.Step 3: Stir in the chillies, tomato purée, stock and tomatoes, bring to the boil, then cover with the lid and cook in the oven for 3 hours. Remove the lid and cook for a further 30 minutes.

method.Step 4: Just before serving, combine the salsa ingredients, taste and season.

method.Step 5: Once the beef is cooked, stir in the chocolate and coriander. Taste and season, then serve with rice, soured cream and the salsa.

title: Veggie chilli with nachos
time: Hands-on time 25 min, simmering time 30 min, oven time 15 min
description: This isn’t just any veggie recipe, it’s a hearty Mexican chilli made with plenty of spices and topped with a crunchy layer of cheesy nachos.
ingredients: Glug olive oil or sunflower oil
2 dried ancho chillies, soaked in hot water for 10 minutes, then roughly chopped
1 tbsp palm sugar or maple syrup
400g can black beans, rinsed and drained
Bunch fresh coriander, stalks finely chopped, leaves roughly chopped
Juice ½ lime, plus 6 wedges to serve
100g lincolnshire poacher, strong cheddar or vegetarian alternative, grated
3 pickled jalapeños from a jar, chopped

method.Step 1: Heat the oil in a flameproof casserole and cook the onion for 5 minutes. Add the peppers for 10 minutes more. Add the chopped ancho chillies, spices, oregano and garlic, then fry for 2-3 minutes. Stir in the passata, vinegar, sugar/syrup and stock, then bring to the boil. Turn the heat to medium and cook uncovered for 30 minutes.

method.Step 2: Heat the oven to 220°C/200°C fan/gas 7. Add the beans, chopped coriander stalks and the lime juice to the chilli on the hob. Cook for 5 minutes, then remove from the heat and cover the top with layers of tortilla chips and grated cheese. Bake for 10-15 minutes until golden brown and the cheese has melted.

method.Step 3: Just before serving, mix the coriander leaves, spring onions and jalapeños in a small bowl, then scatter over the chilli. Serve with lime wedges to squeeze over.

title: Red pepper and courgette enchiladas
time: Hands-on-time 35min, oven time 20 min
description: These vegetarian enchiladas are perfect for Friday night feasting. Gather the troops and serve them up with lashings of guac and chips.
ingredients: 1 large or 2 small red peppers, deseeded and cut into strips
1 tsp each ground coriander and ground cumin, toasted in a pan for 1 minute

method.Step 1: Heat the oven to 200°C/180°C fan/gas 6. Toss the peppers, courgettes and red onion in a little oil in a large bowl. Heat a frying pan over a high heat and fry the veg in batches until tender.

method.Step 2: Toss the fried veg in a bowl with the chilli, ground spices and coriander. Tip back into the pan with a little oil and cook for 4-5 minutes.

method.Step 3: In a wide saucepan, heat a little oil and gently fry the chopped onion for 6-7 minutes. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute, then add the tomatoes and cook for 15-20 minutes.

method.Step 4: Divide the veg among the tortillas and roll up. Spoon a third of the sauce into an ovenproof dish, put the tortillas on top, then pour over the remaining sauce and scatter with the cheese. Bake for 15-20 minutes until golden and bubbling.

title: Beef enchiladas
time: Hands-on time 30 min, oven time 30 min
description: Looking for a way to use up weekend leftovers? Transform half a batch of beef and vegetable stew into cheesy chipotle-spiced enchiladas with this Mexican-style recipe.
ingredients: half a batch of this beef and vegetable stew

method.Step 1: In a large frying pan, heat a glug of vegetable oil and fry the onion for 5-8 minutes until softening. Add ground cumin, ground coriander and chipotle paste, fry for a few minutes, then stir in a tin of chopped tomatoes. Simmer for 15 minutes.

method.Step 2: Heat the oven to 200°C/180°C fan/gas 6. Meanwhile, pour the half-batch of beef stew into a saucepan and gently heat through. If the sauce has thickened up a lot, add a splash of beef stock or water. Put a large frying/griddle pan over a high heat and toast the tortillas, one at a time, until lightly charred on both sides.

method.Step 3: Divide the stew between the tortillas, then roll them up. Put the tortilla rolls in a 1 litre ovenproof dish. Pour over the hot tomato and chipotle sauce, then dollop over 4 tbsp soured cream. Top with grated cheddar and bake for 30 minutes until golden and bubbling. Leave to stand for 5 minutes, then serve with a green salad.

title: Fried kale with black bean chilli and guacamole
time: Hands-on time 40 min
description: Spice up your weekend with this Mexican-style brunch recipe. It’s quick, easy and full of nutritional ingredients that’ll keep you going for the whole day.
ingredients: 2 x 400g tins black beans, drained and rinsed
1-2 red chillies, deseeded and finely chopped
Good dollop of Greek yogurt, plus extra to serve
Hot chilli sauce (we like Lingham’s) or ketchup to serve
110g vine tomatoes, deseeded and roughly chopped
½-1 green chilli, deseeded and finely chopped

method.Step 1: Put the black beans in a pan with the hot vegetable stock and half the red chillies, then cook for 20-25 minutes until almost broken down. Stir in the Greek yogurt and season well, then set aside.

method.Step 2: Meanwhile, for the guacamole, peel, stone and mash the avocados with a fork until creamy but still a bit chunky. Stir in the tomatoes, green chilli and spring onions, then season with salt, pepper and the lime juice.

method.Step 3: Heat the oil in a sauté pan over a medium heat and stir-fry the curly kale with the garlic, remaining red chilli and a splash of water for 10-12 minutes until tender. Season well.

method.Step 4: Bring a pan of water to the boil, with a splash of vinegar if your eggs are not spanking fresh (see Know-how). One by one, carefully crack the eggs into the water. Take the pan off the heat and let the eggs cook for 3-4 minutes until the whites are just firm.

method.Step 5: Divide the kale among 4 plates, scatter over the grated cheddar and top each portion with a poached egg. Serve with the guacamole, black bean chilli, yogurt and, if you like, ketchup or hot sauce.

title: Spicy turkey enchiladas
time: Takes 20 minutes to make, 30 minutes to cook
description: Turn leftover turkey into this comforting and quick-to-make enchilada recipe.
ingredients: 1 tbsp olive oil, plus extra for oiling
5-6 pickled jalapeño slices, chopped, plus a splash of the pickling liquid

method.Step 1: Heat the oil in a frying pan over a low heat and gently fry the onion for 10 minutes until golden and translucent. Add the garlic and chipotle paste and fry for 2 minutes more. Add the tomatoes, 200ml of the stock and the red wine vinegar. Season with a pinch of sugar, sea salt and ground black pepper, then simmer for 15-20 minutes.

method.Step 2: Preheat the oven to 180°C/fan 160°C/gas 4. In another lightly oiled frying pan, fry each tortilla for 30 seconds on one side until golden, re-oiling the pan each time. Set aside. Put the turkey in the empty pan and warm through with the spices, remaining stock and pickling liquid. Remove from the heat and stir in the jalapeño slices.

method.Step 3: Divide the turkey mixture equally among the tortillas, then roll them up. Spread one third of the tomato sauce on the bottom of a large ovenproof dish, then nestle in the enchiladas in one layer. Top with the rest of the sauce, dot all over with dollops of soured cream and scatter with cheese. Bake for 20 minutes until bubbling and piping hot. Leave to stand for 5 minutes, then serve.

title: Cheddar, jalapeño, chilli and sweetcorn muffins
time: Hands-on time 20 min, oven time 20 min
description: Savoury baking doesn’t get much easier than this – grab one of Debbie Major’s cheddar and jalapeño muffins when you’re in a rush or pack one in your lunchbox for a spicy snack.

method.Step 1: Heat the oven to 200°C/180°C fan/gas 6. Line a muffin tray with 12 paper cases. Sift the flour, baking powder and salt into a bowl and stir in the dried polenta,  cheddar and chilli flakes.

method.Step 2: Pour a 284ml pot of buttermilk (or whole milk) into a jug and beat in the eggs and melted butter.

method.Step 3: Mix the milk mixture into the dry ingredients with 160g drained tinned sweetcorn and 1 deseeded, chopped jalapeño chilli. Slice another chilli.

method.Step 4: Divide the batter among the paper cases, sprinkle with 25g grated cheddar and top with chilli slices. Bake for 20 minutes until golden and risen.

title: Parmesan taco shells
time: Hands-on time 10 min, oven time 8 min
description: Let’s taco ’bout how moreish these cheesy shells are. Perfect for packing with fresh ingredients such as avocado and crunchy veg slaw with coriander and a squeeze of lime. Mexi-can-we-have-some-more?

method.Step 1: Heat the oven to 200°C/180°C fan/gas 6. Line two baking sheets with baking paper. Put the cheeses into a mixing bowl and toss together. Spread the cheese into 4 circles, about 15cm in diameter on the baking sheets and bake for about 8-10 minutes.

method.Step 2: While the cheese is cooking, have two large mixing bowls to hand. When the cooking time is up, carefully lift off the baking paper with the melted cheese circles on and place the paper on wire racks to cool for 1 minute. Carefully use a spatula to remove the cheese circles one by one from the baking paper and drape them over the edges of the bowls to shape them. Leave them to cool for 5 minutes, or until completely crisp, then stuff with your favourite taco fillings.

title: Beef fajitas with avocado and sweetcorn salsa
time: Hands-on time 30 min
description: Forget Friday night takeaways – this beef fajitas recipe takes just 30 minutes to make and will feed the whole family.
ingredients: 100g sweetcorn kernels, sliced off the cob, blanched (or tinned, rinsed and drained)
Juice 1 lime, plus wedges or squeezing
Roughly chopped fresh coriander, grated cheddar and soured cream (optional)

method.Step 1: Heat a frying pan over a high heat until smoking hot. Brush 1 tbsp olive oil over both sides of the steaks and season with salt and pepper. Fry the steaks for 2½ minutes on each side (for medium rare). Remove the steaks to a board and allow to rest, loosely covered with foil.

method.Step 2: Add the remaining oil to the pan and fry the peppers, onions and garlic for 5-7 minutes, stirring often. Add the fajita seasoning for the final minutes and cook until the vegetables are tender but still with bite, then remove from the heat.

method.Step 3: Slice the steak into 1cm strips. Put the avocados into a small bowl and mash with a fork to a rough paste. Mix in the sweetcorn and lime juice. Put the tortillas on 4 plates and divide the vegetables and meat among them. Serve with the avocado and sweetcorn salsa and lime wedges to squeeze over, with chopped coriander, grated cheddar and a dollop of soured cream if you like.

title: Vegetarian huevos rancheros
time: Hands-on time 45 min, simmering time 10 min
description: Eggs, chilli, salsa and guacamole served on top of a soft corn tortilla – Sophie Michell’s brunch recipe is the perfect start to the weekend.
ingredients: 1 tsp olive oil, plus extra for frying the eggs
400g can black beans, drained and rinsed
Small handful chopped fresh coriander, plus extra to garnish

method.Step 1: Heat 1 tsp olive oil in a small saucepan over a medium heat. Fry the onion, cumin and chilli flakes for 7-8 minutes until the onion is translucent. Add the beans and 100ml cold water, then season and simmer for about 10 minutes.

method.Step 2: For the guacamole, put all the ingredients in a blender and whizz until smooth. Season, then set aside.

method.Step 3: Combine all the salsa ingredients in a bowl. Season, then set aside.

method.Step 4: When you’re ready to eat, heat the oven to low. Fry the tortillas in a hot dry frying pan for a few minutes on each side until golden. Keep warm in the oven while you fry the eggs.

method.Step 5: Heat a little oil in a medium frying pan over a medium-high heat, then fry the eggs to your liking. When the eggs are ready, get out 2 plates. Put a tortilla on each plate, then spoon some beans on top. Make a well in the middle of the beans, then put a fried egg inside. Sprinkle with the feta and extra coriander, then serve with the guacamole and salsa.

title: Lighter chicken enchiladas
time: Hands-on time 1 ¼ hours, oven time 40 min
description: After a healthy makeover these enchiladas contain 229kcals less than the traditional recipe; a guiltless dinner with a spicy punch.
ingredients: 2 large red peppers, cut into thin strips (about 1.5 cm)
2 British free-range skinless boneless chicken breasts, cut into 2cm strips lengthways
Chopped fresh coriander and crisp green salad to serve
2 tbsp Mexican spice mix (we used Old El Paso Seasoning Mix For Smoky BBQ Fajitas)
2 small fresh jalapeño (or regular green) chillies, deseeded and very finely chopped

method.Step 1: For the tomato sauce, heat the oil in a medium saucepan, then fry the chopped onion for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until translucent, adding the garlic for the final 2 minutes. Add the passata and spice mix, then gently simmer for 15 minutes. Add the chillies, then season well and take off the heat.

method.Step 2: Heat a griddle pan over a high heat until smoking. Lightly brush the onion wedges, peppers and chicken with oil, then griddle in batches for 3-4 minutes on each side until the veg are tender, the chicken is cooked through and everything has grill marks. Set aside on a plate.

method.Step 3: Put the tortillas, one at a time, onto the hot griddle and warm for 10-20 seconds on each side, or until they start to char slightly, then put on a plate covered with a tea towel.

method.Step 4: Heat the oven to 200°C/180°C fan/gas 6. For the béchamel sauce, heat the oil in a medium pan, then vigorously beat in the flour with a balloon whisk to form a smooth paste. Remove the pan from the heat and gradually whisk in the hot chicken stock, bit by bit. When it’s all incorporated, repeat with the Greek yogurt, whisking until smooth and thick enough to coat the back of a spoon.

method.Step 5: To assemble, spread 1 tbsp tomato sauce over the middle of a tortilla. Spoon a line of refried beans down the centre. Top the beans with an eighth of the chicken and veg. Enclose the filling with an overlap, then put in a lightly oiled baking dish (about 20cm x 30cm), seam-side down. Repeat with the rest of the tortillas (see Make Ahead).

method.Step 6: Pour the remaining tomato sauce over the tortillas, then pour the béchamel over (not quite to the edges). Bake for 35 minutes until bubbling. Heat the grill to high, scatter the cheese over the enchiladas, then cook for 5 minutes until golden. Sprinkle with coriander, then serve with salad.

title: Smoky sweetcorn fritters with tarragon yogurt
time: Hands-on 35 min
description: Smoky sweetcorn fritters are vegetarian food done right – served warm from the pan with a dollop of tarragon yogurt and a crisp salad.
ingredients: ½ tsp sweet smoked paprika (also called pimentón dulce)
2 x 340g tins sweetcorn in water, drained
1 small red chilli, deseeded and very finely chopped
Juice ½ lemon, plus wedges to serve

method.Step 1: Put the flour into a medium mixing bowl, then add the milk slowly, mixing it in using a balloon whisk. Add the egg and stir until fully incorporated, then stir in the paprika, sweetcorn, spring onions, crushed garlic and chopped red chilli.

method.Step 2: Heat 2 tbsp oil in a large frying pan over a medium-high heat. Spoon 3-4 ladlefuls of batter into the pan at a time, to make 3-4 fritters, then fry for 3-4 minutes on each side, flipping them over when they’re golden underneath. Remove to a plate lined with kitchen paper while you make the rest, adding oil to the pan each time.

method.Step 3: Mix the yogurt with the tarragon and lemon juice in a bowl and serve alongside the fritters, with a green salad and lemon wedges for squeezing.

title: Ultimate chilli
time: Hands-on 20 min, oven 1 hour 15 min
description: Donal Skehan’s ultimate chilli recipe combines rib-eye steak with kidney beans, chickpeas and spices to make a hearty dish that feeds a crowd.
ingredients: 500g rib-eye steak, finely chopped, fat removed
1 x 400g tin each kidney beans and chickpeas, drained and rinsed
Crusty bread and crème fraîche to serve

method.Step 1: Put a large pot or flameproof casserole over a medium heat and add the oil. Add the onion, garlic, carrots, celery and peppers, then stir in the chilli powder, paprika, cumin and cinnamon. Fry for 7-8 minutes, stirring now and then, until the vegetables are tender.

method.Step 2: Add the meat to the pan and fry gently until lightly browned (about 5 minutes), stirring regularly. Pour in the chopped tomatoes and 250ml water (swill in the empty tomato tins, then add to the chilli to get all the tomato juice out).

method.Step 3: Add the Worcestershire sauce and treacle. Bring to the boil, then reduce the heat and simmer for about 45 minutes, stirring every now and then. Add the kidney beans and chickpeas and simmer for another 15 minutes.

method.Step 4: Season with salt and black pepper to taste, then serve in deep bowls with the guacamole and tomato salsa salad (right), and crusty bread and a dollop of crème fraîche, if you like.

title: Spicy guacamole
time: Hands-on 10 min
description: Serve Donal Skehan’s guacamole recipe with a hearty bowl of chilli, as a dip for tortilla chips or simply spread on toast.
ingredients: Bunch of fresh coriander, roughly chopped

method.Step 1: Halve the avocados lengthways and remove the stones. Scoop out the green flesh, chop roughly and place in a medium-size bowl.

method.Step 2: Stir in the lime juice to stop it discolouring, then add the rest of the ingredients. Season to taste with a good pinch of salt and freshly ground black pepper and that’s it. Enjoy!

title: Tomato salsa salad
time: Hands-on 15 min
description: Donal Skehan’s tomato salsa salad recipe is great served on the side of a meaty chilli or as part of a Mexican feast.
ingredients: 4 medium-size vine-ripened tomatoes, chopped into chunks,
Small handful of fresh coriander, finely chopped

method.Step 1: Add all the ingredients to a medium-size bowl with plenty of sea salt and freshly ground black pepper, then toss well to combine.

title: Spicy Mexican tortilla soup with avocado salsa
time: Hands-on time 25min, simmering time 30 min, oven time 5 min
description: A vegetarian soup recipe, full of Mexican flavour that makes best use of store cupboard ingredients; perfect for weeknight supper.
ingredients: ½ dried ancho chilli, soaked in boiling water for 15 minutes, then drained (see tips)
400g tin kidney beans, drained and rinsed
400g tin black beans, drained and rinsed
Soured cream and lime wedges to serve
Small bunch fresh coriander, leaves picked and stems chopped
1 fresh jalapeño (or green) chilli, seeds removed, finely sliced

method.Step 1: Heat the oven to 200°C/180°C fan/ gas 6. Heat the olive oil in a large, deep saucepan over a low-medium heat, then add the onion and garlic and cook gently, stirring now and then, for 8 minutes or until very soft. Split the ancho chilli open, scrape out the flesh inside (discard the skin) and add it to the pan with the paprika and cumin. Cook for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.

method.Step 2: Add the vegetable stock and tinned tomatoes and bring to the boil, then cook for 15 minutes or until ￼￼the liquid has reduced slightly. Add the beans and sweetcorn and cook for 5 minutes more.

method.Step 3: Meanwhile cut the tortillas into 8 small triangles and brush on both sides with a little olive oil. Lay the triangles in a single layer on a baking sheet, then toast in the oven for 4-6 minutes until golden and crisp – keep an eye on them as they can burn easily (there’s no need to turn them).

method.Step 4: For the salsa, cut the avocados into small cubes, put in a bowl, drizzle with the extra-virgin olive oil and squeeze over the lime juice. Add the coriander and chilli, then season well with salt and pepper and mix. 4 Serve the soup hot in bowls with the salsa, a dollop of soured cream and some tortilla chips, with extra lime wedges on the side.

title: Quick chilli con carne
time: Hands-on time 30 min, cooking time 20-25 min
description: When you fancy a chilli con carne but don’t have the time for slow cooking – this is the quick chilli recipe for you.
ingredients: 1 tsp smoked paprika (pimentón), hot or sweet, depending on how hot you like your chilli con carne
400g tin red kidney beans, drained and rinsed
Coriander leaves, lime wedges, soured cream and warmed tortillas or steamed rice

method.Step 1: Heat the oil in a large sauté pan over a medium-high heat and add the onions. Cook for 10 minutes, stirring often, until softened and translucent. Add the garlic and fry, stirring, for 2 minutes more until fragrant, then tip out into a bowl.

method.Step 2: Turn up the heat to high, add the beef to the pan and season well, pressing it down with a wooden spoon and breaking it up so it browns all over. When it’s browned, tip out the juices from the pan and discard, then return the onions to the pan with the cumin, paprika and cinnamon. Cook, stirring, for 2-3 minutes until fragrant, then add the tomatoes with a pinch of sugar and the beef stock.

method.Step 3: Bring to a simmer and cook, stirring occasionally, for 20-25 minutes until the beef has taken on the flavours of the spices and the sauce is reduced and thick. Add the kidney beans and cook for 5 minutes more, then taste, season and serve with your choice of accompaniments.

title: Tres leches cake with white russian syrup
time: Hands-on time 45 min, oven time 30-35 min
description: A classic cake that you can find in Mexico, central and south America – but this time combined with the flavours of a white russian cocktail. It’s a great recipe to add to your dinner party repertoire.
ingredients: Sunflower oil or butter for greasing
180ml whole milk (we like a creamy milk such as gold top)

method.Step 1: Heat the oven to 180°C/160°C fan/ gas 4. Lightly oil or grease a 20cm square cake tin and line the bottom with baking paper (see tip). Separate the eggs, putting the whites in a large mixing bowl with the sugar. Whisk with an electric mixer to stiff peaks (about 4-5 minutes), then whisk in the yolks. Using a metal spoon, fold in the melted butter and finally the flour with a pinch of salt, taking care not to knock the air out of the mixture.

method.Step 2: Gently pour the batter into the lined tin, then bake in the middle of the oven for 30-35 minutes until the cake is risen, golden and springy to the touch. Remove from the oven.

method.Step 3: Mix all the ingredients for the syrup, apart from the double cream, in a bowl. When the cake is still warm, leave it in its tin and gently poke holes all over it with a skewer. Spoon over half the syrup slowly, letting it sink in before continuing (reserve the rest of the syrup in the fridge). Leave the cake to cool completely in the tin, then cover with cling film and leave to stand for at least 1 hour or overnight.

method.Step 4: When ready to serve, mix the rest of the chilled syrup with the cream and divide among deep plates or shallow bowls. Remove the cake from the tin and slice into squares, then sit the squares in the cream mixture. Scatter with the coffee beans and dust with cocoa powder, then serve immediately.

title: Ernesto’s winning chilli
time: Hands-on time 30 min, simmering time 40 min
description: Ernest Puga Cardoso’s winning entry to the Great chilli cook off- you can be assured this recipe packs a flavoursome punch.
ingredients: 500g 10% fat British Aberdeen Angus beef mince
400g tin kidney beans, drained and rinsed
30g dark chocolate (85% cocoa solids), broken into pieces
Ripe avocado, soured cream, fresh coriander sprigs and soft flour tortillas to serve (optional)

method.Step 1: Heat the oil in a medium pan over a low heat. Add the onion and cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until translucent. Add the garlic, pepper and vine tomatoes and cook, stirring, for 6-8 minutes until the tomatoes have softened.

method.Step 2: Make a space in the centre of the mixture, then add the chilli powder, paprika and cumin. Mix well, then cook for around 5 minutes.

method.Step 3: Meanwhile, season and cook the mince in a separate pan over a high heat for 8 minutes or until browned.

method.Step 4: Drain the mince, then add it to the tomato mixture, along with the wine. Stir over a high heat until the wine evaporates. Stir in the oregano and thyme, then the tomato paste. Reduce the heat to low and cook for 1 minute. Add the tinned tomatoes and stock. Cook for 5 minutes; stir occasionally.

method.Step 5: Add the bay and cinnamon, then cover the pan with a lid and simmer for 30 minutes, stirring now and then.

method.Step 6: Remove the lid and stir in the beans and sweetcorn, then cook, uncovered, for 10 minutes. Taste and season, then stir in the chocolate until it has melted. Remove the pan from the heat, then discard the bay leaves and cinnamon stick. Serve in bowls topped with avocado slices, soured cream, coriander sprigs and a grind of black pepper, with soft flour tortillas on the side, if you like.

title: Beef chilli with dark chocolate
time: Hands-on time 30 min, simmering time 40 min
description: Ernesto Puga Cardoso won our Great Chilli Cook-Off competition with this beef and dark chocolate chilli recipe.
ingredients: 500g 10% fat British Aberdeen Angus beef mince
400g tin kidney beans, drained and rinsed
30g dark chocolate (85% cocoa solids), broken into pieces
Ripe avocado, soured cream, fresh coriander sprigs and soft flour tortillas to serve (optional)

Reduce the heat to low and cook for 1 minute. Add the tinned tomatoes and stock. Cook for 5 minutes; stir occasionally.

title: Smoky beef chilli with black beans
time: Hands-on time 40 mins, simmering time 3 hours, plus soaking
description: Jennifer Joyce’s smoky beef chilli recipe is full of fresh Mexican flavours and packed with black beans and a real chilli heat.
ingredients: 900g beef shin, cut into 3 cm cubes
2 X 400g tins black beans, drained and rinsed

method.Step 1: Boil the kettle and heat a frying pan over a high heat, add the dried chillies and cook until they puff up, turning once, for about 30 seconds.  Remove and put in a medium bowl, cover with boiling water and leave to soak.  Weight them down with a small plate if they float to the top and leave until soft, about 15 minutes. Put the chillies in a blender and pour 100ml of the tomato passata in to help it blend until very smooth, then set aside.

method.Step 2: Season the beef with salt and pepper. Heat 1 tablespoon of the olive oil in a large saucepan with a lid or casserole over medium-high heat. Cook the beef, in batches, for 1–2 minutes each side or until browned all over, then remove and set aside.

method.Step 3: Reduce the heat to medium-low, add the remaining oil, onion and garlic, season with salt and pepper and cook for 5–6 minutes or until softened. Add the spices and chipotle purée to the onion mixture and cook for a few minutes.

method.Step 4: Add the chilli paste, remaining passata, vinegar, sugar, beef and the teaspoon of salt. Cover with a lid and cook for 3 hours on a very low heat or until the beef is tender. Add the beans and warm through. Top with the onion, avocado, coriander, cheese and serve with tortilla chips, if you like.

title: Drunken caterpillar chilli con carne
time: Hands on time 1 hour 15 min, simmering time 4 hours
description: This ‘caterpillar’ chilli recipe uses pig cheek as well as beef shin and beef mince making this Mexican-inspired dish extra hearty.
ingredients: 400g tin plum tomatoes or fresh tomatoes (see tips)
400g tin black beans, drained and rinsed
2 whole mild chillies such as pasilla, mulato or ancho, or a combination
500g boneless beef shin, trimmed, or heel of beef
300ml porter, or other dark beer, such as Guinness
1 tsp chilli piquin powder or other chilli powder
1 tsp powdered chipotle chilli (about half a large chipotle chilli)
1 tsp sal de gusano (chilli salt made with crushed caterpillars) or Maldon smoked salt

method.Step 1: Heat the oven to 200’C/180 fan/gas 6. Top, tail and quarter the onion and separate the layers. Put in a roasting tray with the garlic, half the oregano, a good drizzle of extra-virgin oil, the muscovado sugar and the tomatoes. Toss together until coated, cover with foil and cook for 40 minutes, then remove the foil and cook another 20 minutes. Transfer to a blender and pulse; you want a chunky consistency not a purée, and set aside.

method.Step 2: Mash half the beans into a paste, leave the others whole and set aside. Put a large frying pan on high heat and toast the whole mild chillies, star anise and cumin seeds for a minute or two until smoking a little. Transfer to a blender or pestle and mortar and grind into powder, then set aside.

method.Step 3: Cut the beef and pork cheek into rough 4cm chunks. Heat a large pan or casserole on a high heat and add a glug of flavourless oil. Brown the meat in batches until nicely browned, turning occasionally, for about 5 minutes, then set aside as you go. Cook the mince in the same pan until brown, about 2-3 minutes. Add the rest of the meat back in and pour in the beer. Boil until the liquid is reduced by half, about 6-8 minutes.

method.Step 4: Add in the reserved tomato and onion mix, the remaining dry ingredients, reserved oregano, treacle and 250ml beef stock. Cover and cook on the lowest heat for 4 hours on the hob. Stir the meat occasionally to prevent it from burning and sticking, If it is looking too dry add a little more stock. Check the meat after 4 hours, it should be so tender it gives no resistance when you shred it.

method.Step 5: Remove the big chunks of meat from the pan and shred using two forks. Return to the pan, stir to combine, add the black beans and black bean paste, add more stock if you want a looser consistency, adjust the chilli heat and seasoning to taste. Serve with coriander, sour cream, pickled jalapeños and tortilla chips, if you like.

title: Barbecue sweet potatoes with garlic and herb dressing
time: Hands-on time 15 min, barbecue or oven time 1 hour
description: Simply wrap sweet potatoes in foil then leave to slowly cook in your barbecue embers while you make a gorgeous garlic and herb soured cream topping.
ingredients: Small bunch fresh flatleaf parsley, chopped
Small bunch fresh mint, chopped, plus extra leaves to serve

method.Step 1: Put each sweet potato on a large piece of foil. Drizzle over olive oil and season well. Wrap tightly and put in the barbecue embers for 45-60 minutes. Alternatively, roast in an oven heated to 200°C/180°C fan/gas 6 for 1 hour 20 minutes.

method.Step 2: Meanwhile, wrap the garlic cloves in a little foil, drizzle with olive oil, and leave in the embers for 15-20 minutes until soft (or cook in the oven, as above, for 20 minutes). Finely slice the red onion and put in a non-metallic bowl with most of the lemon juice and a pinch of salt.

method.Step 3: When the garlic is cool enough to handle, squeeze the flesh from the skins into a large bowl and drizzle with a little more olive oil. Mix in the soured cream or yogurt gradually to distribute the garlic evenly.

method.Step 4: When ready to serve, add the chopped herbs, lemon zest and the remaining lemon juice, season and taste. Remove the onions from the lemon juice, squeezing them dry.

method.Step 5: Open the sweet potato parcels, squash the flesh open a bit, spoon over the garlic and herb dressing, scatter with the onions and extra mint leaves, then serve in the foil.

title: Griddled cheesy cornbreads
time: Hands-on time 5 min, barbecue time 5-6 min
description: Use these cheesy flatbreads for dipping into houmous, as a side to salads and soups, or wrapping around beef koftas.
ingredients: 150g self-raising flour, plus extra for dusting

method.Step 1: Put the flour, polenta or cornmeal and sea salt in a mixing bowl, add the yogurt and cheese, then mix with a fork. Bring it all together with your hands into a soft, not wet, dough (add a splash of water if it’s too dry).

method.Step 2: Tip out onto a lightly floured work surface, knead for 2-3 minutes until smooth, then divide into 6 pieces and roll each into a 10cm circle. Cook the cornbreads on a medium-hot barbecue for 2-3 minutes on each side until puffed and charred.

method.Step 3: Serve with these homemade beef koftas.

title: Leftover chicken quesadillas
time: Hands-on time 15 min
description: This quesadilla recipe is a great way to use up leftover roast chicken and makes a perfect lunch to take to work.
ingredients: 75g cooked chicken or pancetta or a mix of both (or same weight in veg)

method.Step 1: Combine the meat and/or veg with the cheese spring onions, chilli and coriander. Season well.

method.Step 2: Heat a glug of oil in a large frying pan. Put one tortilla in the pan and top with the filling, leaving a narrow border around the edge. Put another flour tortilla on top, then press down gently. Cook over a medium heat, pressing down on the quesadilla, for 3 minutes or until the underside is deep golden. Carefully flip the quesadilla over with a fish slice and cook on the other side in the same way until the underside is toasted and the cheese is melted. Serve cut into wedges.
